data.title: Hooters closing underperforming stores: Are Naples, Fort Myers, Cape Coral locations on list?
data.meta_description: Hooters will continue to open locations domestically and internationally while launching Hooters frozen products at grocery stores.
data.text:
Hooters has closed some of its restaurants statewide but the good news is that its three Southwest Florida locations will remain open.

So far, at least 44 " Hooters restaurants have been permanently closed in 14 states including Florida. This is in response to "pressure from current market conditions," the chain told USA TODAY.

Here's what we know.

Where are Hooters in Southwest Florida and have they closed?

Southwest Florida Hooters are in Naples, 3625 Gateway Lane; 4411 Cleveland Ave., Fort Myers; and 3120 Del Prado, Cape Coral.

"There are no Southwest Florida, South Florida, Sarasota or Bradenton stores closings ... the 15 Hooters of South Florida area stores are owned and operated by Hooters of South Florida, a separate entity from HOA," Ilona Wolpin with Anoli Management, wrote in an email, referring to Hooters of America of HOA.

What Hooters closed in Florida

There's still 44 Hooters open in Florida. Here's the four that closed:

Hooters, Gainesville, 3105 SW 34th St.

Hooters, Lakeland, 3437 South Florida Ave.

Hooters, Orange Park, 1740 Wells Road

Hooters, West Palm Beach, 2020 Palm Beach Lakes Blvd.

Hooters began in Florida

Hooters is a Sunshine State original, first opening in 1983 in Clearwater, on Gulf to Bay Boulevard connecting Tampa to Clearwater Beach.

Opened by six businessmen “with absolutely no previous restaurant experience,” according to the restaurant’s website, it was incorporated on April Fool’s Day, 1983, and opened on Oct. 4 of that year.

Hooters to Home of the Whopper: A look at popular restaurant chains that began in Florida

What is Hooters known for

Hooters serves up food including wings, sandwiches and burgers. The chain also is known for its Hooters calendars sold later in the year and sponsors charity benefits.

Dave Osborn is the regional features editor of the Naples Daily News and News-Press. Follow him on Instagram and Threads @lacrossewriter and on X (formerly Twitter) @NDN_dosborn.
